error.signature: exec: "ffmpeg": executable file not found in $PATH
error.regex: exec:.*executable file not found in \$PATH|exec\.LookPath.*not found

verdict.summary: os/exec.Command or exec.LookPath cannot find the specified binary in the system PATH. The executable is either not installed or not in a directory listed in $PATH.

dead_ends.action: Hardcode an absolute path to the binary
dead_ends.why_fails: Absolute paths break portability across systems where the binary is installed in different locations (e.g., /usr/bin vs /usr/local/bin vs /snap/bin)

workarounds.action: Install the missing binary and ensure it is in PATH
workarounds.how:
apt-get install <package>  # or brew install / yum install
which <binary>  # verify it's in PATH

workarounds.action: Use exec.LookPath to check availability before exec.Command

leads_to.condition: when the binary exists but in a directory without execute permission

preceded_by.condition: when missing C compiler triggers exec not found for gcc

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'executable file not found in $PATH' means the binary does not exist in any PATH directory, while permission denied means the file exists but cannot be accessed.
